text: this is going to be a bad year for the
iPhone Apple is going to release a new
iPhone in September and for now let's
just call it the iPhone 7 so far we know
a lot about it it's going to look very
similar to the iPhone 6s except for some
redesign antenna lines on the back and a
larger camera lens for better photos oh
and there there's a whole thing about
them removing the headphone jack but at
first glance you're really not going to
notice much difference from the last two
generations the iPhone which will
probably keep a lot of people from
upgrading this year and that's pretty
bad news for Apple because it's already
been a slow year for the iPhone sales
have been down for the first time in the
products nine-year history and with a
lack of design change in the new iPhone
7 that trend is likely to continue but
that could all change in 2017 which will
be the 10-year anniversary of the iPhone
and so far we know it's going to have a
brand new glass design with the display
taking up the entire front that means no
more home button and a fingerprint
sensor that's embedded beneath the glass
of the front overall it's going to be a
huge redesign and to find what the
iPhone is for the next several years but
as for this year it's gonna be a little
disappointing if you're hoping for
something brand new from Apple and as
for me I'm going to hang on to my
two-year old iPhone 6 plus and wait till
next year when something really special
comes out there's just going to be a lot
more to look forward to next year
